required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Of Tocilizumab in Patients With Moderate to Severe Active Rheumatoid Arthritis Who Have an Inadequate Response to or Are Unable to Tolerate Biologic and Non-Biologic Disease-modifying Antirheumatic Drugs (DMARDs)
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Tocilizumab in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis on Background Non-biologic DMARDs and Monotherapy Who Have an Inadequate Response to Current Non-Biologic or Biologic DMARDs

brief_summary.textblock: This 3 arm randomized open label study will evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of tocilizumab in patients with moderate to severe active rheumatoid arthritis, who have had inadequate response to or are unable to tolerate DMARDs. The protocol incorporates risk mitigation strategies developed in partnership with the FDA to manage known and potential risks associated with the treatment of tocilizumab. Patients will be randomized to receive tocilizumab either 4 mg/kg intravenous (iv) or 8 mg/kg iv with concomitant non-biologic DMARDs, or 8 mg/kg iv without concomitant non-biologic DMARDs, every 4 weeks, for a total of 6 infusions. The anticipated time on study treatment is 3-12 months, and the target sample size is 500-1000 individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing at Least One Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the 24 Week Treatment Period
primary_outcome.description: An SAE was any adverse event that at any dose fulfilled at least one of the following criteria: Was fatal (results in death) Was life-threatening Required in-patient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization Resulted in persistent or significant disability/incapacity Was a congenital anomaly/birth defect Was medically significant or required intervention to prevent one or other of the outcomes listed above.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Serious Adverse Events of Special Interest
secondary_outcome.description: Serious Adverse Events of Special interest include: Serious infections including opportunistic infections Complications of diverticulitis (including lower gastrointestinal [GI] perforations) Myocardial infarction/acute coronary syndrome Stroke Spontaneous or serious bleeding Malignant neoplasms

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Non-serious Adverse Events of Special Interest
secondary_outcome.description: Non-serious adverse Events of Special interest include: Serious/Medically Significant Hepatic Events Spontaneous /Serious Bleeding Malignant Neoplasms

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinical Remission at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Remission is defined as a Disease Activity Score 28 [DAS28] < 2.6. The DAS28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in RA. The index includes tender joint count (TJC) -28 joints and swollen joint count (SJC)-28 joints, acute phase response (CRP) and general health status. The DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores represent higher disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in DAS28 Score at Weeks 8, 16 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The index includes tender joint count (TJC) -28 joints and swollen joint count (SJC)-28 joints, acute phase response C-reactive protein (CRP) and general health status. The DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores represent higher disease activity. A score of < 2.6 represents clinical remission, a score of ≤ 3.2 represents low disease activity, and a score of > 5.1 represents high disease activity. The Change from Baseline to Weeks 8, 16 and 24 is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving American College of Rheumatology (ACR) (ACR20/50/70) Responses at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The ACR response rates ACR20, ACR50, and ACR70 are defined as ≥20%, ≥50%, and ≥70% improvement from baseline, respectively, in: Swollen Joint Count (66 joints) and Tender Joint Count (68 joints) and At least 3 of the following 5 assessments: Patient's global assessment of pain-Visual Analog Scale (VAS) Patient global assessment of disease activity-(VAS) Physician global assessment of disease activity-(VAS) Patient assessment of disability (physical function scale of the Multidimensional Health Assessment Questionnaire) Acute phase response C-Reactive Protein (CRP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Tocilizumab Dose Increased From 4 mg/kg to 8 mg/kg at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Dosage could be increased from 4 mg/kg Tocilizumab to 8 mg/kg due to failure to achieve 20% improvement from baseline in swollen and tender joint counts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Having Their Tocilizumab Dose Increased From 4 mg/kg to 8 mg/kg at Weeks 12, 16, and 20
secondary_outcome.description: Dosage of Tocilizumab 4 mg/kg could be increased to 8 mg/kg at the discretion of the investigator based on assessment of the patient's benefit-risk after Week 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Routine Assessment Patient Index Data (RAPID3) Score at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The RAPID3 is a combined index derived from the Multidimensional Health Assessment Questionnaire that includes physical function score, pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS), and global assessment of disease activity VAS. The total RAPID3 score ranges from 0 to 10 where higher scores represent worse outcomes. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The fatigue VAS is a single-item, patient-reported outcome that measures the severity of the fatigue over the past week. Patients rate their fatigue on a scale of 0 (fatigue is no problem) to 100 (fatigue is a major problem). Higher scores represent higher disease activity and a negative change from baseline indicates improvement.

arm_group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions for 24 weeks. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase at the investigator's discretion.

Participants received Tocilizumab (TCZ) 4 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. Participants not achieving a 20% improvement from baseline in tender and swollen joint counts at Week 8 were to have their dosage increased to 8 mg/kg, per protocol. Beginning at Week 12 dosage increase to 8 mg/kg was at the discretion of the investigator. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase at the investigator's discretion.

Participants received Tocilizumab (TCZ) 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase at the investigator's discretion.

intervention.description: 8 mg/kg intravenous every 4 weeks for 24 weeks
Nonbiologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) As prescribed

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 1129 patients were screened for the study. Of these 1129 patients, 886 patients were enrolled and 243 patients were screen failures.

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions for 24 weeks. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

group.title: Tocilizumab 4 mg/kg + DMARD
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab (TCZ) 4 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusion plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. Participants not achieving a 20% improvement from baseline in tender and swollen joint counts at Week 8 were to have their dosage increased to 8 mg/kg, per protocol. Beginning at Week 12 dosage increase to 8 mg/kg was at the discretion of the investigator. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg + DMARD
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusion plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. The dosage could be decreased to 4 mg/kg for safety reasons at the investigator's discretion. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

participants_list.participants: 4 patients from 8 mg/kg +DMARD arm did not receive DMARD, included in Monotherapy arm for safety.
1 patient from Monotherapy arm and 1 from 8 mg/kg +DMARD, included in 4 mg/kg +DMARD arm for safety.
28 patients from Monotherapy arm received DMARD, included in 8 mg/kg +DMARD arm for safety.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Violation of selection criteria at entry

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Baseline measures are based on the number of participants in the Safety Population who received at least one dose of study drug and who had at least one post baseline safety assessment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing at Least One Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the 24 Week Treatment Period
outcome.description: An SAE was any adverse event that at any dose fulfilled at least one of the following criteria: Was fatal (results in death) Was life-threatening Required in-patient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization Resulted in persistent or significant disability/incapacity Was a congenital anomaly/birth defect Was medically significant or required intervention to prevent one or other of the outcomes listed above.
outcome.population: Safety Population. Patients were included in the TCZ dose group according to the first infusion they actually received. Patients were assigned as using a nonbiologic DMARD if they took at least 1 dose of nonbiologic DMARD during the treatment period. Patients who did not take at least 1 dose of nonbiologic DMARD were considered as on monotherapy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinical Remission at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
outcome.description: Clinical Remission is defined as a Disease Activity Score 28 [DAS28] < 2.6. The DAS28 is a combined index for measuring disease activity in RA. The index includes tender joint count (TJC) -28 joints and swollen joint count (SJC)-28 joints, acute phase response (CRP) and general health status. The DAS28 scale ranges from 0 to 10, where higher scores represent higher disease activity.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population includes participants who received at least one dose of study drug. Patients were included in the treatment group to which they were randomized or assigned, regardless of the treatment actually received. "n" in each of the categories is the number of participants with data available for analysis at the given time point.

Patients were assigned as using a nonbiologic DMARD if they took at least 1 dose of nonbiologic DMARD during the treatment period.

Patients were assigned as using a nonbiologic DMARD if they took at least 1 dose of nonbiologic DMARD during the treatment period.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Routine Assessment Patient Index Data (RAPID3) Score at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
outcome.description: The RAPID3 is a combined index derived from the Multidimensional Health Assessment Questionnaire that includes physical function score, pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS), and global assessment of disease activity VAS. The total RAPID3 score ranges from 0 to 10 where higher scores represent worse outcomes. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population includes all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Patients were included in the treatment group to which they were randomized or assigned, regardless of the treatment actually received. "n" in each of the categories is the number of participants with data available for analysis at the given time point.

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions for 24 weeks. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

group.title: Tocilizumab 4 mg/kg + DMARD
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab (TCZ) 4 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusion plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. Participants not achieving a 20% improvement from baseline in tender and swollen joint counts at Week 8 were to have their dosage increased to 8 mg/kg, per protocol. Beginning at Week 12 dosage increase to 8 mg/kg was at the discretion of the investigator. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg + DMARD
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusion plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. The dosage could be decreased to 4 mg/kg for safety reasons at the investigator's discretion. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Routine Assessment Patient Index Data (RAPID3) Score at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
measure.description: The RAPID3 is a combined index derived from the Multidimensional Health Assessment Questionnaire that includes physical function score, pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS), and global assessment of disease activity VAS. The total RAPID3 score ranges from 0 to 10 where higher scores represent worse outcomes. A negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat population includes all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Patients were included in the treatment group to which they were randomized or assigned, regardless of the treatment actually received. "n" in each of the categories is the number of participants with data available for analysis at the given time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fatigue Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) at Weeks 8, 16, and 24
outcome.description: The fatigue VAS is a single-item, patient-reported outcome that measures the severity of the fatigue over the past week. Patients rate their fatigue on a scale of 0 (fatigue is no problem) to 100 (fatigue is a major problem). Higher scores represent higher disease activity and a negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population includes all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Patients were included in the treatment group to which they were randomized or assigned, regardless of the treatment actually received. "n" in each of the categories is the number of participants with data available for analysis at the given time point.

The dosage could be decreased to 4 mg/kg for safety reasons at the investigator's discretion. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

measure.description: The fatigue VAS is a single-item, patient-reported outcome that measures the severity of the fatigue over the past week. Patients rate their fatigue on a scale of 0 (fatigue is no problem) to 100 (fatigue is a major problem). Higher scores represent higher disease activity and a negative change from baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat population includes all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Patients were included in the treatment group to which they were randomized or assigned, regardless of the treatment actually received. "n" in each of the categories is the number of participants with data available for analysis at the given time point.

reported_events.time_frame: Includes Adverse Events that occurred during the 24-week Treatment Period and the Long-term Extension Period (up to 72 Weeks)
reported_events.desc: Safety population. Patients were included in the TCZ dose group according to the first infusion they actually received. Patients were assigned as using a nonbiologic DMARD if they took at least 1 dose of nonbiologic DMARD during the treatment period. Patients who did not take at least 1 dose of nonbiologic DMARD were considered as on monotherapy.

group.title: Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg Monotherapy
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusions for 24 weeks. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

group.title: Tocilizumab 4 mg/kg + DMARD
group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab (TCZ) 4 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusion plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. Participants not achieving a 20% improvement from baseline in tender and swollen joint counts at Week 8 were to have their dosage increased to 8 mg/kg, per protocol. Beginning at Week 12 dosage increase to 8 mg/kg was at the discretion of the investigator. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

group.description: Participants received Tocilizumab 8 mg/kg as a 60 minute intravenous infusion every 4 weeks for a total of 6 infusion plus non-biologic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) of the investigator's choice for 24 weeks. The dosage could be decreased to 4 mg/kg for safety reasons at the investigator's discretion. Participants who completed the 24 week treatment period were offered the option of entering a long-term extension phase.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
